newsitem.title: USA: CSCE cocoa futures called to open little changed.
newsitem.headline: CSCE cocoa futures called to open little changed.

text.p: CSCE cocoa futures were called to open little changed Wednesday, although some traders expected prices to weaken in line with losses in London overnight.
London cocoa futures continued to trend lower Wednesday, with benchmark LIFFE March falling 13 stg a tonne at the midday break, to 912 stg. Spot December was off 12 stg at 881 stg.

New York cocoa futures tumbled to their lowest level in more than seven months on Tuesday, pounded by speculative selling. Most-active March cocoa tumbled $32 a tonne on the day, to $1,351, its lowest settlement since late March, after ranging narrowly between $1,383 and $1,350.
Spot December, which goes into notice period Thursday, also fell $32, to $1,305.
Technically, traders continued to peg near-term March support near the $1,350-$1,347 level, with the next downside target seen at $1,335. Resistance was put at $1,365.
